title: Mother-of-two claims giving up work to stay at home with children is 'lonely as f***'
text:
A mother-of-two has left many fuming after she took to Facebook to claim that giving up work to stay at home with her children was 'lonely as f***'.

Caitlin Fladager, 23, from Vancouver, ranted about being a stay-at-home mother in a now-viral Facebook post in which she wrote she found it 'mentally draining' being 'stuck' at home.

Her comments sparked social media debate as many said they would 'love' the privilege of giving up work.

One commented: 'I would give anything to be able to stay at home with my daughter.'

Caitlin Fladager, 23, from Vancouver, sparked debate online after ranting about how being a stay-at-home mother was 'lonely as f***'

In a Facebook post that has now been liked 19,000 times, Caitlin wrote: 'When I told people I was a stay-at-home mom, and planned to be for quite a few years, they would always go on to say how lucky I was. Or how I should be so appreciative for that opportunity.

'But all I could think in my mind was “then why do I feel so f****** lonely all the time?”⁣

⁣'While I am very grateful I have been able to be a stay-at-home mom for the past four years, it’s also been one of the hardest times of my life.'

'People always talk about the upside of it. Spending more time with your kids, getting to witness their first milestones, and all of that stuff. '

Mother-of-two Caitlin complained that 'nobody prepared' her for 'the downside' of staying at home with her children (pictured, Caitlin with her husband Noah, daughter Arianna and son Jack)

Caitlin's rant quickly went viral on Facebook, with over 19,000 people liking her post about being a stay-at-home mother

She went on: 'But what no one prepared me for, was the downside and mental health struggles that come with that.'

'Nobody tells you about how much you will lose your patience. ⁣ Nobody tells you that you won’t leave the house sometimes for days. ⁣ ⁣

'Nobody tells you how hard it is asking for help when you need it. ⁣ ⁣ Nobody tells you it’s not easy.'

Calling it 'mentally draining', she added: ' Nobody tells you that no matter how many hours are in a day, you still won’t feel like you have done enough. ⁣ ⁣

Caitlin said she felt 'lonely' and 'drained' being 'stuck in the same routine' with her children every day (pictured, with son Jack and daughter Arianna)

'Nobody tells you how draining being stuck in the same routine, everyday, is.'

She added: 'Yes, I am grateful I am able to stay home with my kids. But that doesn’t mean I can’t talk about how hard it is.'

Social media users were left divided over the post, with some saying they would 'love' to stay at home with their children.

One commented: 'Don't forget that there's moms who have to work day and night and barely get to see their kids.

Some social media users were stunned by the mother's post, with many commenting they 'loved' being stay at home mothers

'I know people in the medical field who miss birthday parties, family outings, and even something as small as supper with their family every day.

She added: 'The grass isn't always greener on the other side. Being a mom whether it's a stay at home mom or a working mom can both be hard and lonely. Isolating even.'

Another wrote: 'I was a stay-at-home mother. I loved it! I don't think it was hard at all. I wasn't lonely. I had family and friends.'

One added: 'I would give anything to be able to stay at home with my daughter.

Others defended Caitlin, praising her for speaking so openly, with one commenting that her post was 'well said!'

'I feel like I miss out on so much having to work full time. So in my opinion, being able to afford to have me stay at home would be a luxury to ME and hopefully in the future we will be able to afford this.'

But others defended the post online, with one commenting: 'This is why I had to go back to work, one child or four children I needed that outside connection. Not everyone can be a stay at home mom.'

One added: 'Well said! I was a stay at home mother and this is the very reason I went back to work. My kids are teenagers, the oldest is 18, and I've been working a while but when I was doing it this is the truth.'
description: Caitlin Fladager, 23, from Vancouver, posted the rant about being a stay-at-home mother on Facebook. She said she found it 'lonely' and 'draining' being 'stuck' in a routine with two children.
